item.title: Every Video Game Norman Reedus Has Appeared In, Ranked
item.description:
With the release of Death Stranding 2 , Norman Reedus has made yet another major appearance in the video game landscape. The star of The Walking Dead has cultivated a great working relationship with Kojima to form something special.

This talented actor has made appearances in several other games, whether as Sam Porter Bridges or Daryl Dixon. Players who want to enjoy games featuring their beloved celebrity's face will find the following titles to be right up their alley.

8 The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct

Fell Way Short Of The Mark And Didn't Do Justice To The Walking Dead IP

The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct
FPS
Systems
Released
March 19, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct is a game that simply had too many issues to resonate with fans. The combat was uninspired, and the title failed to invoke a sense of fun and accomplishment in players.

This game documents the history of the Merle brothers before they eventually stumble upon Rick and his group. It could've made for an interesting adventure, but the game doesn't do justice to the likenesses of both actors with a forgettable action title that could've been so much more.

7 State Of Survival

The Freemium Mechanics Make This Title A Nightmare To Play, Even With Norman Reedus As A Possible Hero

Freemium games usually feature massive marketing budgets to convince more players to download their games and enjoy the simple yet satisfactory gameplay loop in these titles. State of Survival is no exception here, with players having to set up defenses and prevent their base from being overrun by zombies.

This setting is perhaps why this game paid the big bucks to acquire Norman Reedus' likeness for their game. As long as players don't mind the slow progression loop (something that can be mitigated with microtransactions), they should get some mileage out of State of Survival , which can serve as a fun distraction if players have some time to spare.

6 The Walking Dead: Onslaught

A Simple VR Walking Dead Game That Feels A Lot Like Arizona Sunshine

The Walking Dead: Onslaught
Virtual Reality
Adventure
Shooter
Indie Games
Fighting
RPG
Systems
Released
September 29, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
7 /10

ESRB
m
Powered by

When people think about great Walking Dead games, Saints & Sinners is one of the more notable mentions. It's one of the better action games that boasts a simple and engaging gameplay loop, with the act of grabbing zombies to shoot or stab them never getting old.

However, one title that gets lost in the shuffle here is The Walking Dead: Onslaught . Featuring iconic characters from the franchise (including Daryl Dixon), Onslaught is a fun, if somewhat simple, VR action game that players can get their hands on.

5 Call Of Duty: Modern Warfare 3

Norman Reedus Is One Of The Possible Operators That Players Can Control In The Game

Call Of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 (2023)
6 /10
20
7.4 /10
Released
November 10, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Modern Warfare 3 is a fun entry in the long-running series that fans will have a great time with. Call of Duty has made a habit of letting players use wacky operators in combat, and this title is no exception.

Players can use Daryl Dixon as an operative, allowing them to control a beloved celebrity as they shoot down everyone in sight. It's a fun operator for players to control, especially if they love Norman Reedus' presence in the video game landscape.

4 Death Stranding

A Unique Open-World Game That Stars Sam Porter Bridges

Death Stranding
4 /10
26
7.8 /10
Released
November 8, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Strong Language
Powered by

Death Stranding is one of the most polarizing video games ever made, with fans either loving the unique gameplay loop of this title or hating the walking simulator side of things. Either way, more and more people have warmed up to this beautiful title over time, to the point where fans will love Kojima's eccentricities in this title.

Sam Porter Bridges is a fun character, especially with Norman Reedus doing a great job of portraying him. Players will be invested in his journey as he delivers packages and completes several important missions.

3 Fortnite

Norman Reedus Is One Of The Many Skins That Players Can Use

Fortnite
265
8.9 /10
Released
September 26, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen - Violence
Powered by

As easy as it may be to dunk on Fortnite , one can't deny that this game's rampant popularity stems from its tight and satisfying gameplay loop. Players love the charming gameplay and fun action as players construct massive structures in record time as they try to win a challenging Battle Royale.

The popularity of this game has caused marketing to go berserk for this title, acquiring the appearances of several popular figures, fictional or otherwise. Norman Reedus is also a part of this game as the iconic Daryl Dixon, whom players can control and get an elusive victory.

2 Death Stranding 2: On The Beach

A Huge Improvement Over Its Predecessor That Makes For A Stellar Open-World Title

24 Images
24 Images
Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
9.0 /10
Released
June 26, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Violence, Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Strong Language
Powered by

Death Stranding 2 is a massive improvement over its predecessor, featuring major improvements to gameplay that make everything from traversal to the occasional action segments more riveting. The addition of different locations for players to explore doesn't hurt, either.

Sam Porter Bridges makes a triumphant return to the gaming mainstream, with this title featuring all the quirks and oddities that players would expect from a Kojima game. From hidden birthday celebrations to lengthy yet riveting cutscenes, there's no shortage of iconic Kojima-isms in this game that make this Norman Reedus-starring video game so much fun to play.

1 P.T.

A Mind-Blowing Playable Teaser That Revealed Norman Reedus As The Main Character At The End

P.T.
Survival Horror
Systems
5.5 /10
Released
August 12, 2014
ESRB
m

Powered by

To this day, the what-if posed by P.T. hurts fans to this day. If Konami had managed to mend things with the most reputable developer working for them, the company could've turned the Silent Hill franchise into something special way before its eventual revival.

Seeing Norman Reedus as the protagonist of a playable teaser that announced the now-cancelled Silent Hills game was mind-blowing. Most people argue that this moment is what cemented this actor as one of the most beloved celebrities among video game fans.

item.title: All Main Missions in Dune Awakening
item.description:
Dune Awakening is an expansive open-world MMO that also immerses the player in its lore with its main missions that slowly unravel the plot threads. The main mission follows the story of the Fremen and uncovers their untimely extinction at the hands of the Sardaukar. These missions aren't only for the narrative, but also allow you to learn about the Fremen way of life and learn their various methods of surviving the harsh desert of Arrakis.

All Main Missions in Dune Awakening

There are a total of nine main missions in Dune: Awakening that are divided into two acts. The starting missions act more like a tutorial, helping players to learn the ropes. However, the game does let you roam the complete map of Hagga Basin after you leave the southern territory. Let's check out all the main missions for Dune: Awakening.

Act

Sub Missions

The Glutton

The Paranoid

The Next Target

Further Instructions

A Sign From Above

New Targets

Water Fat

Last Target

The Jackal

A Rendezvous with Ari

Searching for Answers

So, there were all the main missions players can complete in Dune: Awakening . In addition to these main quests, there are also contracts that you can pick up at tradeposts that also offer Solaris and lore about the world.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered Mod Turns the Game Into an FPS
item.description:
A new mod for The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered shakes up the game's fantasy formula and turns it into an FPS. With the mod, players can freely run around Oblivion Remastered taking down enemies with a gun in place of a bow.

While Bethesda is known for releasing mod-friendly games with the framework needed to readily set them up in-game, Oblivion Remastered isn't included on that list. Bethesda revealed that Oblivion Remastered wouldn't be receiving mod support, but that hasn't stopped players from figuring out how to get it done and releasing tons of mods anyway.

Now, a mod from user CosmicBoogaloo on NexusMods has introduced the ability to replace a player's bow with a Glock pistol, converting the game into something more akin to a first-person shooter. The mod is aptly titled "Glock - Functional Gun in Oblivion Remastered," and a brief gameplay video shows the player running around in Oblivion itself shooting everything that crosses their path. The gun can be added to the player's inventory as a standalone weapon, or if preferred, players can replace all the default Iron Bows in the game with Glocks. For now, players will need to enable the Oblivion Remastered console to spawn in a Glock and its associated ammo, but the modder notes that they will be releasing an update with an NPC to sell these items in the future.

Oblivion Remastered Mods are Plentiful Despite Lack of Official Support

Although the game doesn't officially support mods, there have been plenty that have dropped for the game since its April release. Some popular Oblivion Remastered mods include those that add new factions, one that adds a settlement placing system similar to Fallout 4 , and even a mod that lets players leave notes for other Oblivion Remastered players, similarly to Dark Souls . And of course, plenty of mods that make minor tweaks to improve the experience of the game have also appeared.

While making Oblivion Remastered include mod support would have made the process easier for modders, plenty of games that lack official mod support have received extensive lists of mods nonetheless. Given that the original Oblivion and its follow-up Skyrim have remained popular and maintained active playerbases in part thanks to the endless modding capabilities, it's not a huge surprise that Oblivion Remastered seems to be following in the original's footsteps even without Bethesda's help. It may only be a matter of time before players are able to shape the Oblivion Remastered experience into something completely unlike the original experience by nstalling multiple mods.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Hideo Kojima May Have to Break One of His Coolest Traditions With His Next Game
item.description:
Hideo Kojima, the visionary behind the Metal Gear Solid and Death Stranding franchises, is memorable for his affinity for grandeur in terms of scale, plot, and character design. His team’s latest game, Death Stranding 2: On the Beach , has received praise for its high-fidelity environments and character models.

He is also known for being quirky — a feature that has translated into his games in the form of Death Stranding 2 Prepper cameos, and more recently, a heartwarming birthday tradition. This tradition began in Metal Gear Solid V and continued in the Death Stranding games, since becoming a beloved Easter egg. However, his next project, OD , presents a unique challenge that may see him break this ritual.

The Birthday Surprise Is Now A Kojima Hallmark

Kojima has made it a point to acknowledge players’ birthdays within his games. In Death Stranding 2 , for instance, it's a mandatory request for players to input their dates of birth at the start (or whatever arbitrary dates players want to select). Then, on that day in real life, there's a heartwarming scene waiting in the wings.

NPCs gather around the first-person camera and sing to the player, offering their well-wishes with gifts of pizza, candles, and confetti. Although this gesture might seem fickle to some, it goes a long way in creating a nice moment of emotional connection to the game. Over the years, fans of Kojima games have come to love this birthday tradition in its multiple iterations as it adds a touch of humanity to even the most serious narratives in a characteristic post-apocalyptic world.

However, Hideo Kojima’s next game, OD , marks a departure from his recent works. Described as a horror experience that explores “what it means to OD on fear,” OD is marketing itself as a chilling and unsettling experience. In collaboration with Xbox Game Studios and Jordan Peele, the critically acclaimed director and writer of smash-hit horror movies like Nope and Get Out , Hideo Kojima is giving the horror genre another shot, and this decision might pose a threat to the recent birthday celebration tradition.

OD’s Horror Setting Might Make Birthday Celebrations Feel Out Of Place

Given OD ’s horror tone, the inclusion of a surprise birthday party scene might feel jarring. The game is rumored to lean on psychological horror, so it is likely going to be heavy on mood and introspective fear. With such a theme in mind, the inclusion of a warm or upbeat birthday celebration contrasts against OD 's creepy tone.

That said, Death Stranding and Death Stranding 2: On the Beach alone represent bizarre amalgamations of many unique genres, and OD primarily being a horror game does not mean that it is guaranteed to not have any levity or clashing tones. It wouldn't be a 'Kojima' game if it led fully with horror and didn't subvert genre expectations, even with Jordan Peele having a big role in OD , but only time will tell whether the birthday tradition is upheld.

Kojima has always walked a fine line between immersion and self-awareness. His games are packed with meta-references, quirky detours, and Easter eggs, yet they rarely disrupt the emotional flow of the underlying story. Although walking this narrative line is Kojima's specialty, the horror video game scene is less forgiving, so his creative philosophy might clash with itself.

If anyone could make a birthday message feel appropriate in a horror game, it is Hideo Kojima. Still, there is a genuine chance that OD may be the first game from Kojima Productions in a decade to skip the birthday cake and the candles. While that might be the right call in the context of the tone, the gimmick's absence would certainly be felt.

item.title: How to Have the Best Start in Persona 5: The Phantom X
item.description:
Persona 5: The Phantom X is a Gacha spin-off of the original, introducing several new characters to players in a familiar world. While several activities may seem familiar to returning players, they work quite differently here. It'll take a while to find your bearings in this entry. However, this guide will point you in the right direction and towards activities that will benefit you the most at the start of your adventure.

Focus on the Main Missions

Most of the activities in P5X will be locked to a certain level threshold, hence you'll need to focus on completing the main missions to open up the game. Doing this will ensure that you have access to most of the in-game mechanics, can work on building your characters, and can participate in new events.

However, there will be some moments where you'll have to level up Wonder to a particular rank to progress the story. Don't worry, the activities mentioned ahead will help you in that regard.

Prioritize Unlocking Personas for Wonder

Wonder can equip multiple Personas in P5X , which lets him target a range of enemy affinities . At the start, he'll only have one Persona equipped, but there are certain activities you can do to unlock more Personas for him, including.

  • Following Main Missions
  • Progressing Through Kiuchi's Palace
  • Fighting Personas in the Realm of Repression
  • Trying Your Luck on a Banner

Complete Your Daily & Weekly Quests

Make sure to check off your daily and weekly quests every day to level up Wonder quicker and avoid getting stuck in a level-gated situation. These quests also offer a ton of rewards, like ascension materials, Meta Crystals, and other items to help you progress your account very quickly .

Make Sure to Complete Lufel's Plan Objectives

Lufel's Plan is available at the start, and you focus on completing all its steps , at least for Plan 1 in Persona 5: The Phantom X .

The reason why you should focus on Lufel's Plan is that completing all seven steps will allow you to choose between three 5-Star Phantom Thieves , which otherwise you'd have to rely on your luck to get.

Complete 50 Pulls from Newcomer Banner

You'll get a lot of Golden and Platinum tickets at the start of your journey, which you should put to good use. Instead of randomly selecting a banner to pull from, make sure to spend your Golden Tickets on multi-pulls from the first (newcomer) banner .

Completing 50 pulls from the Newcomer banner will also let you snag a 5-Star Phantom Thief , among a selection of three.

Participate in the Take Your Heart Event

The first event for the global release of Persona 5: The Phantom X is Take Your Heart. The event has a ton of activities and challenges to indulge yourself in early on. It also offers a stack of rewards to players who invest time in completing all its activities, which aren't that hard to do.

Fans of the original will also get to meet the iconic Phantom Thieves once again in Café LeBlance, so you can look forward to that as well.
